intro: Anaphalis zollingeri, commonly known as the silverleaf frostflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the spring and early summer. Its leaves are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a silvery appearance. Anaphalis zollingeri is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
